description:
Household members

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
12211 Microcensus

Definition:
All persons who run a household alone or together with other
people are the population in households. They are also
called household members. The population in collective
living quarters is excluded, while households within
collective living quarters are included.
The population in households is the difference between the
population entitled to accommodation and the population in
collective living quarters. As a person may be entitled to
accommodation in several households, he or she may be
counted twice. The absent household reference person, for
example, who lives in another municipality and has a second
residence as a subtenant there, is part of two households.
First, such persons belong to the household of their family
and second, as subtenants, they form one-person households.
This is justified by the fact that households use
residential space and the facilities of the respective
municipality at each place of residence.
The results for household members and the population in
private households differed until 1990 because different
extrapolation methods were used for these two value
variables.
